New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player to hit 50 homers and steal 50 bases in the same season.
No player in baseball history had hit three homers and stolen multiple bases in a game, until Ohtani did it on Thursday.

Ohtani crammed all that production into a single Thursday afternoon during a 20-4 thrashing of the Marlins, including 10 RBIs, a six-hit day, a five extra-base hit day, a three-homer day, and a multi-steal day within his career.
Key Match Events: Ohtani went 6-for-6, slugged three home runs, drove in 10 runs and swiped two bases — in a game that clinched a postseason berth.
Ohtani singlehandedly pummeled the Miami Marlins on Thursday.
Ohtani had not gotten thrown out trying to leg out a triple in his third at-bat, he’d have added his second career cycle, too.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights in this article.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said after Ohtani’s outburst, “Sorry, Shawn,” Roberts said, “But just in totality I don’t know that I’ve seen anything like this.”
Mookie Betts said, “What we see is like expected. It’s crazy that he lives up to those types of expectations. But that’s also what makes you speechless.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game clinched a postseason berth.
Ohtani has set a new standard for the 6-for-6 day, surpassing Shawn Green's 19 total bases in a single game.
Ohtani is the first player to collect six hits while occupying the designated hitter spot in a game.
Others: Ohtani's performance might pale in comparison to what he authored during Thursday’s display of dominance, according to Gavin Lux.

Ohtani's two-way performance in a June 27, 2023 start against the White Sox, where he struck out 10 while allowing one run in 6 ⅓ innings, all while smacking two home runs and going 3-for-4 at the plate.
